definition.name: NXbias_spectroscopy
definition.doc:
A base class for bias spectroscopy to describe the change in the physical properties of the sample with respect to the sweep voltage applied on a sample of STM/AFM/... experiment.
In these experiments an electric potential is applied between the (conductive) sample and the probe (tip), and the physical properties (e.g. tunnelling current) is measured as the function of this potential. The potential is varied in so-called voltage sweeps and the corresponding properties are recorded accordingly.

field.name: measurement_type
field.doc: The measurement of the I(V) curve can come in two ways: 1. Constant spacing: The bias voltage is swept from the start to the end with a constant spacing between the tip and surface. 2. Variable spacing: The bias voltage is swept from the start to the end in a discretized spacing between the tip and surface. (Either an array of voltages, or the steps are defined).

group.doc:
The PID (proportional, integral, differential feedback system) positioner information while running bias voltage-tunneling current measurement.
These components position the probe relative to the sample, thus help obtaining maps of the data across the sample surface.

field.name: z_offset
field.doc: The z-offset is a starting tip position before the sweep starts (typically the position of a piezo element).

field.name: acquisition_time
field.doc: The time or period is taken by a bias sweep to acquire the data for a single bias sweep point (when the given point or whole sweep is started.).

field.name: animation_time
field.doc: The time or period is taken by a bias sweep to be displayed.

field.name: measurement_time
field.doc: The time or period is taken by the circuit to measure a full bias sweep voltage or bias current. (duration of the measurement)

field.name: indicators_period
field.doc: The time or period is taken by the circuit to indicate the bias sweep voltage after measuring the voltage.

field.name: scan_type
field.doc:
The type of scan like mesh, spiral, etc.
This combines not only how the voltages are changed, but how the voltage values are correlated to a position across the sample surface, measuring sweeps are each spatial coordinate or mapping the response at constant voltage, etc. For STS experiment, the scan type is usually a single-point scan (trajectory scan).

field.name: sweep_number
field.doc: The number of sweeps taken during the bias spectroscopy.

field.name: first_settling_time
field.doc: The initial time is taken to settle the bias voltage at the desired value. On each sweep usually, the system takes time to settle to the bias voltage at the next value.

field.name: end_settling_time
field.doc: The time is taken to settle the bias voltage at the desired value. The time (at the last sweep) to settle for the last value of the sweep.

field.name: max_slew_rate
field.doc: The rate at which the amplifier responds to the voltage change (to reach at the desired value). It defines if the tip movement and voltage sweep are synchronized.

field.name: final_z
field.doc: The z position after the sweeps are done.

field.name: total_spectroscopy_time
field.doc: The total time needed for the entire voltage sweep.

group.name: scan_region
group.doc: The region of the scan area.

field.name: scan_range
field.doc: The range of the scan area.

field.name: scan_offset
field.doc: The offset of the scan area in 2D (X and Y) space.

field.name: scan_angle_N
field.doc: The N (substring) denotes the angle of the scan area with different physical axes.

group.name: linear_sweep
group.doc:
The linear scan information for scanning of a smaple.
In this scan type the probe is scanned with a constant velocity across the surface, and parameters are measured along the line.

field.name: scan_speed
field.doc: The speed of the scanner or the probe during the scan.

field.name: scan_time
field.doc: The time taken by the scanner to scan the entire area.

field.name: forward_speed_bias
field.doc: Speed of the scanner or the probe moves forward direction.

field.name: backward_speed_bias
field.doc: Speed of the scanner or the probe that moves backward direction.

group.name: SCAN_data
group.doc: The data that comes from scanning the area.
